I've not seen this in action before it was just test-deployed here. I like the status visibility generally, but I'm wary of the irregular layout it generates when I see eg. (only) 2 people with a status, leading to different spacing in the user list between the green/orange/... circles/dots. That might be improved with slightly tighter user<->status spacing? Or maybe if we have the profile pictures it'll presumably be uniformly spaced with statuses?
I can imagine reducing the top-margin for the status elements by a like 3 pixels to make them visually bind more closely to the name above them.

I'm also wondering if we want a slightly higher opacity, like 0.6, than the current 0.5. (I think our default intermediate grey is 0.7, but I'm not sure that actually looks good after trying it in the inspector.
This will be an independent option from profile pictures, so we should design a version of this that we think looks good.

So I'd propose we do these CSS changeS:

  • Opacity 0.5 to 0.6
  • Add margin-top: -3px for span.status-text:not(:empty).

Yeah I think the irregular layout is the concept for this version. If one's going to have a regular layout spending 2 lines for each user, that'd be the "include avatars" setting option, which we do plan to add.

The proposal seems reasonable to me.

I think the other thing worth thinking about is how we want the settings labels for this to work. The options would be this:

**Buddy list style** (dropdown label)
* Low density (avatars always visible; status messages will appear if present)
* Show status messages only if present, aka what we're testing right now.
* Show only status emoji, aka the current `main` behavior (status messages available on hover)

Not sure how to explain that or name the variables, but I think one of the blockers for this will be figuring out how we're going to describe those options, which would then be an input into what we name the options in the code.
I suppose one option for the UI would be to have it work more like the emoji display choices, where we show what the options look like rather than trying to explain them.
image.png

I have started working on this and I wanted to discuss some of the implementation details for this setting and clarify a couple things as well before I proceed further.

  1. The commit structure: I was thinking of splitting the PR into 2 commits - where the first commit adds the setting (backend changes) and the second commit implements it.
  2. I wanted to clarify the default value for the setting. Currently I'm going with RIGHT_SIDEBAR_COMPACT (the 3 choices are described in this comment on GitHub).
  3. One other thing I wanted to clear up was the exact placement of the setting.

@Raghav Luthra I think it goes in the "Theme" section of "display settings" (though it shouldn't be a "legacy display setting" in the API -- nothing new should be added to that). I'd make it a new last item in the "Theme" section; it's easy to swap things around if that isn't best.
I think we likely want the default to be the version currently test-deployed, i.e. displaying the status.
Those proposals sound good to me.

Chatting with Vlad Korobov, we were thinking that whenever we are displaying the status text, it would make sense to put the status emoji to the left of that text, rather than to the right of the user's name. @Raghav Luthra would you be up for making that change?

If a users has a status emoji set but no status text, we would continue to show the emoji to the right of the name, so that it doesn't take up an extra line.
That seems like a great idea.
We have some tiny tweaks remaining for this PR but I'm hoping for it to merge in the next couple days.
I filed Improve how names and statuses are shown #22910 with a handful of remaining improvements.

As Alya Abbott hinted, We've merged #21040, which adds the new setting for controlling the right sidebar style.

We have immediate follow-up polish work to do in the form of #22910, and then after that gets integrated, we can start working on adding the option to show avatars, which should hopefully not be super hard (a lot of the complexity of this was getting the plumbing working sensibly).
The merged version is now running on chat.zulip.org.

Chatting with Vlad Korobov, we were thinking that whenever we are displaying the status text, it would make sense to put the status emoji to the left of that text, rather than to the right of the user's name. Raghav Luthra would you be up for making that change?

If a users has a status emoji set but no status text, we would continue to show the emoji to the right of the name, so that it doesn't take up an extra line.

What if the status text is independent of the emoji used?
It would look weird for the emoji to be before text in that case.

Screenshot-2022-09-10-at-11.02.53-PM.png

What if the status text is independent of the emoji used?

Vlad Korobov said:

What if the status text is independent of the emoji used?

I thought they are set as dependent thing.

The UI to set your status (a) puts the emoji and the status text alongside each other, and (b) has a bunch of default statuses where the emoji hints at the text. But you can customize them to have any combination of emoji + text.

Screen-Shot-2022-09-12-at-1.47.30-PM.png

Given that, I think the situation where the two are related will be common, and it generally doesn't seem terrible to me to put them alongside each other even when they aren't related, as #22910 proposes.

On the other hand, it feels odd to have the information split across two lines when they are related.

But curious what other folks think.

Yeah I think I agree with all of those statements. I think Aman's concerns are potential reasons the change might not work out in practice, which is one reason I didn't want to block on this change, but I think it'll feel more clear in practice when we test deploy it.

One consideration that hasn't been mentioned is we also display status emoji next to your name in the message feed itself:

image.png
So there is an argument for status emoji always appearing next to your name if we want to just have a consistent pattern for how users are displayed in the core UI.
Well, I see it more as a special case and would expect actual status to be in the tooltip on hover over emoji or even next it if there is a space for it

Yeah I'm finding it hard to decide which way I think is better in the abstract. I imagine it won't be hard to try the other approach (though it won't be completely trivial; just because I happen to know the existing HTML/CSS structure is fairly messy) and see how we like it, so that continues to be my recommendation for a path forward here.

Works for me!

In terms of it feeling systematic, I think putting the status emoji next to the status text when it's present and after the name when there is no text is a reasonable pattern. But let's try it and see. :)

the status is supposed to be in a lighter font color than the name

This is a small-ish polish thing, but I see Evy's status text getting clipped without an ellipsis ("…"):

image.png

so that, unless I hover over it, I could easily mistake the text as ending with 'my name rhymes' instead of what it really ends with: 'my name rhymes with "heavy"'.

Better, I think, to show an ellipsis to convey that the text has been truncated. Then the user might try a hover interaction, which would give them the full text.
